meanings.definition: A person who explains or interprets something.
meanings.sent1: The expositors at the museum guided us through the art exhibition.
meanings.sent2: The expositors in the courtroom helped the jury understand the complex case.
meanings.sent3: The expositors at the science fair made learning about physics fun and engaging.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were expositors of her emotions, revealing everything she felt.
meanings.sent5: The expositors in the documentary eloquently presented the historical events.

meanings.definition: A book or article that explains or interprets a particular subject.
meanings.sent1: The library had a wide selection of expositors on various scientific topics.
meanings.sent2: I found an interesting expositors on ancient civilizations at the bookstore.
meanings.sent3: The expositors on gardening made me laugh with their quirky illustrations.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an expositors of knowledge, always ready to share insights.
meanings.sent5: The expositors on astronomy painted a vivid picture of the night sky.
